description: From Late Latin abacinātus, perfect passive participle of abacinō; possibly formed from ab (“off”) + bacīnum (“a basin”) or bacīnus. Probably cognate with modern Italian abbacinare (“to dazzle”).

verbs.description: abacinate (third-person singular simple present abacinates, present participle abacinating, simple past and past participle abacinated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, rare) To blind by holding a red-hot metal rod or plate before the eyes
